page.title: 06ARBROATH SMOKED HADDOCK.
page.content: We interviewed two local shopkeepers from our area.We found out that smokies are actually smoked haddock. To smoke them you put them in what they call a barrow which is a big pit. After being smoked for forty minutes by hardwood logs they are ready to be sold.Most are sold locally or sent to London but some are exported abroad. The smokie{trade}is a growth{industry {. }More locals are involved in making smokies than at the turn of the century. They are made in the same way that they were made when smokies were first introduced.Smokies have become part of Arbroath's {local history.}They are very popular with {tourists.}They are a local delicacy and are very tasty. Some tourists take them home for their family to enjoy.
